variants.HGVS: N.D. (HGVS nomenclature standardization via API is not possible without specific cDNA and protein change information in a format suitable for API call. Here only amino acid changes G309D, L347P, W437X are given in the text)
variants.Description in input context: PD - linked PINK1 G309D, L347P, and W437X mutations

Material used.Description: HeLa cells transfected with pPINK1 - FLAG or the vector control were used for affinity purification.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (No specific variant - related readout for this assay method in the given text)
Readout description.Result Description: Mass spectrometry analysis identified the 75 - kDa PINK1 - associated protein as TRAP1.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector control was used as a negative control.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Commonly used for identifying protein - protein interactions)

Material used.Description: HeLa and PC12 cells were transfected with the indicated plasmids for immunoprecipitations.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (No specific variant - related readout for this assay method in the given text)
Readout description.Result Description: Endogenous PINK1 co - immunoprecipitated with TRAP1 in PC12 cells, and none of the PINK1 mutations examined had a significant effect on the ability of PINK1 to bind TRAP1.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Commonly used for studying protein - protein interactions)

Experiment Method.Assay Method: In vitro and in vivo phosphorylation assays

Material used.Material Name: FLAG - tagged wild - type or mutant PINK1, TRAP1
Material used.Description: In vitro: Affinity - purified FLAG - tagged wild - type or mutant PINK1 was incubated with TRAP1. In vivo: Endogenous TRAP1 protein was immunoprecipitated from PC12 cells.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (abolished kinase activity to phosphorylate TRAP1)
Readout description.Result Description: In vitro, the G309D mutation virtually abolished the kinase activity of PINK1 to phosphorylate TRAP1. In vivo, cells overexpressing G309D mutant PINK1 had approximately 50% lower levels of both basal and oxidative - stress - induced TRAP1 phosphorylation than untransfected cells.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: loss - of - function (abolished kinase activity to phosphorylate TRAP1)
Readout description.Result Description: In vitro, the L347P mutation virtually abolished the kinase activity of PINK1 to phosphorylate TRAP1. In vivo, cells overexpressing L347P mutant PINK1 had approximately 50% lower levels of both basal and oxidative - stress - induced TRAP1 phosphorylation than untransfected cells.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: partial loss - of - function (reduced kinase activity to phosphorylate TRAP1 in vivo)
Readout description.Result Description: In vitro, the W437X mutation had no significant effect on PINK1 - mediated TRAP1 phosphorylation. In vivo, the mutation caused a 30% to 45% reduction in both basal and oxidative - stress - induced levels of TRAP1 phosphorylation compared with wild - type PINK1.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent mean ± SEM from three independent experiments.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey's post hoc analysis

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Commonly used for studying protein phosphorylation)

Material used.Description: PC12 cells were used for immunofluorescence confocal microscopy to analyze the intracellular distribution and colocalization of PINK1 and TRAP1.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Qualitative (visualization of protein localization and colocalization)

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (No specific variant - related readout for this assay method in the given text)
Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 and TRAP1 colocalize in the mitochondria, and the mitochondrial colocalization of PINK1 with TRAP1 was not affected by the pathogenic PINK1 mutations.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Commonly used for studying protein localization)

Material used.Description: PC12 cells were homogenized and fractionated for subcellular fractionations.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Qualitative (identification of protein localization in subcellular compartments)

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (No specific variant - related readout for this assay method in the given text)
Readout description.Result Description: Endogenous PINK1 and TRAP1 were both primarily found in the mitochondrial inner membrane and intermembrane space fractions.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Commonly used for studying protein localization in subcellular compartments)

Material used.Description: PC12 cells were transfected with siRNAs targeting PINK1 or TRAP1.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (measurement of gene knockdown and its effects on cell processes)

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (No specific variant - related readout for this assay method in the given text)
Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 siRNA - 1 and PINK1 siRNA - 2 inhibited the expression of endogenous PINK1, and H₂O₂ - induced phosphorylation of endogenous TRAP1 was significantly decreased. TRAP1 siRNA - 1 and TRAP1 siRNA - 2 reduced the expression of endogenous TRAP1, and TRAP1 depletion resulted in increased oxidative - stress - induced cytochrome c release and cell death.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent mean ± SEM from three independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: A control siRNA with no known mammalian homology was used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey's post hoc analysis

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Commonly used for studying gene function by knockdown)

Material used.Description: PC12 cells were treated with H₂O₂ for cell viability and apoptosis assays.
